etymologies: Middle English raisons of Corauntz, translating Anglo-Norman French raisins de Corauntz ‘grapes of Corinth’ (the original source)

definitions: a small dried fruit made from a seedless variety of grape originally grown in the eastern Mediterranean region, now widely produced in California, and much used in cooking
shortDefinitions: small dried fruit made from small seedless variety of grape originally grown in eastern Mediterranean region and much used in cooking

definitions: a Eurasian shrub which produces small edible black, red, or white berries.

notes.text: Genus Ribes, family Grossulariaceae: numerous species, includingblack currant and red currant

shortDefinitions: Eurasian shrub which produces small edible black

definitions: a berry from a currant shrub.
